summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) draft report on the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in 2006-2008. The emails discuss technical issues with sharing and making the large report searchable.

persons.name: Cauraingersoll
persons.context: Sends the OPR draft report and cover letter regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Handling of Epstein Matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period under review by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: OPR Draft Report Transmitted
events.description: OPR Director transmits a draft report and cover letter regarding the Epstein matter to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.
The draft report and a cover letter were transmitted to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
The attached draft report was over 380 pages long and presented technical challenges as it was not searchable, requiring conversion.
The correspondence indicates an internal DOJ review process regarding the professional conduct of prosecutors in the initial Epstein case.
